Posts.Content: On 8/14/2008 platinum wrote: I had back pain on one side and across my mid to lower back starting about half way through chemo, due, according to the doctors, to the pain that the combination of Taxol and Neulasta shots cause. It continues, in an abated, come and go way, ever since. I have done acupuncture and massage, but it still hangs on. Stretching and advil help. Drs say it is muscle pain, not a sign of cancer. Has anyone else had this lingering pain? I finished chemo in April.
Posts.Title: back pain during and after chemo

Posts.Content: Yes  I have just finished chemo, and my lower back is always achy.  I mentioned it to my oncologist Friday, and he thought it was the chemo.  Taxotere more than likely.,  It isnt getting any better as yet.  I had a back Xray of my spine and he saw some degeneration, but nothing to warrant the pain I have.  So I am going with his idea that it is the chemo effects.  It's like I can only walk a certain distance before I have to sit because of the pain.  Is yours like that?  I also have noticed I retain fluid in my ankles and lower legs, but that also is a sign of chemo:(  I think I may try the Tylenol Arthritus strength and see if that helps.  Hope this helped somewhat.  Good Luck.  Joyc
Posts.Title: back pain during and after chemo

Posts.Content: I have been on Fermara for 3 yrs now, after having a double mastectomy and chemo & radiation.  I have tried different drugs, Arimidex aromasin, etc.  I ended up with Fermara, But my bones are really really getting worse as for pain.  I have tried to deal with it for 3 yrs, But I am seriously thinking of going off the drug.  Its not a guarantee that cancer wont come back, But Yes its supposed to help.  Does anyone else have these side effects??  If so what do you do for them>? Thank you Joyce
Posts.Title: Fermara, Aramisin etc etc Pain>? Need Help

Posts.Content: You're very welcome.  IF you feel well let me know how you did,. But please dont get onl;ine if you;re feeling terrible.  Its not worth it   Do take the nausea pills if they give you a script for them.  Prayers being sent to you
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: God Bless you  Bonnie:   hey took 5 lymph nodes with me too on this last one.   The first one 22 years ago, the Dr took all of them.  22 years ago was different then tho.  But he was great.  I was lucky it didnt return for that many years.  I agree with you it is different in every woman,  I tried Arimidex and the Aromasin, had problems with both, the Femara (letrozole)  isnt much beter, and Yes I agree it does a heck of a job on our joints,  So you must have another year or so to go on the hormone therapy?  Right back atcha as being brave, I think all of us are.  And Yes United we do stand.  Please keep up with the good attitude makes a difference.  But during it, its kinda hard to maintain that one.  Keep in touch my Friend.  Joyce
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: Jan I actually had invasive ductal cancer also.  So this last time there were no Lumps, which floored me when I went for my mammo, thinking all was ok, but wasnt turned out to be stage 3b  stage breast cancer. Had 3 lumpectomies to try to get clear margins, but they couldnt  then got a bad infection, so I immediately talked to my PCP and said I want to go to another Hospital closer with a surgeon I had heard was excellent.  She immediately, after I sogned off from the Dr in Boston, took  me on and had a double mastectomy, which strong rounds of chemo & radiation. Neulasta shots.  I am still on a 5 yr hormone pill.  I tried arimidex, but had side effects am s taking Femara now, but I think depending on the strength they basically all ruin your bones .  My oncologist & Pcp said thats the bad side of those pills, so basically I put up with it. But I['m 65 now,  had my first round of cancer 22 yrs ago, and came back in other breast 22 years later.  So I take it day by day and my goal of the day is "If I can make just one person smile I;ve met my goal"   Its horrid disease, But we've all got it or had it, and might as well try to make the best of a lousy situation.  I have always felt that I can help others by the things I went thru, as far as cancer goes.  As it truly helps me knowing I can make it easier for someone else.  Well if there is easy. lol  I have a "super" oncologists.  Actually the same one my Mom had, we went thru radiation together.   And we were closer then than ever before.  Unfortunately she died  shortly after that.  But we talked about so many things, and when I lost my hair she actually shaved her head also..  She did try that really expensive pill, but had side effects to it, so she stopped, as she knew she only had 6 months and didnt want them to be worse.  But she really only got 2 months.  Wow  I really have rambled on here, but anyways if theres anything I can say or do to help someone else just ask.  I do have to take some pills for the joint & bone pain from the hormone pill, but thats normal I have been told.  Altho my Aunt took Tamoxofen 8 yrs ago and only had hot flashes, so maybe it depends on the mgs or the type of cancer or age or whatever  lol.  One never knows all the details with the "C"  other than it can really get you down or try and have alot of upbeat friends and relatives  help you.  Did you get nauseaous (sp) with your treatments?  Theres alot of different pills they tried and they seemed to be so helpful with me.  But anyways before I go into my lifes story lol, I will close hoping someone got something out of this.  And you're right when you say 'been there'   take care & Bless you  Joyce
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: Hi   what stage cancer did you have?   I had 3b, and they gave me the 2 you;re getting plus one more, I think it was taxatere.  But it was a heavy dose.  I agree I was more scared of the chemo than the double mastectomy.  But what she mentioned about the xanax is a good ideA.   I take an anxiety drug also, its klonopin, which helped me also.  I dont know if they told you that you would get sick or not??  I only know I did loose all my hair, it did come back baby fine, and got sick, but they gave me compazine.  Ah sometimes it helps sometimes it doesnt.  But drink alot, I hated drinking fluids and every tme I got chemo the day after I was back for IV for dehydration  So Please be sure and drink water or anything your stomach can handle.  Jello is great too.  Happy Birthday Monday, maybe it will start a whole new beginning for you.  Hope this helped.  Joyce
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: What excellent advice.  My hair started about the th day, was really quick.  I was told I could shave it and save all the crying during it falling out in the shower.  So I did, and My Mom did, who has now passed from Lung cancer, my Sister and my nephews.   W I think we al have each other here and thats a good thing. Yes you need something to look forward to.  Even if it sems small keep it in your mind and fight this with all you can..  Pryaers are sent
Posts.Title: Petrified of getting chemo

Posts.Content: Yes I have terrible pain in my legs and joints. And you are the first to say Fish Oil.  My PCP just told me to take that.  I have only taken it for a week, but will let you know how it works.,  I also have been given pain pills,  but try not to take them too much as I dont want to become addicted to them.   I am seriously considering going off the Femara.  They are doing a bone scan to be sure nothing is making this pain.  But if nothing shows up (which I hope doesnt)  I will ask what are the repercussions of going off the pill, as its a pain day after day.  I am a 2 yr survivor and know I am lucky, but sometimes the pain is unbearable. Joyce
Posts.Title: stopping arimidex before time

Posts.Content: I took arimidex also and had problems they changed me to Letrozole.  But have basically same effects.  But I didnt notice a leaky bladder until recently,  But have been on the pill for 3 1/2 years now.  And my bones do Kill me.  But if yours is leaking too much call the Dr maybe theres something they can give you or switch you to another pill.  Good Luck none of this is easy.  Good thing we have each other in here.
Posts.Title: SIDE EFFECTS FROM ARIMADEX

Posts.Content: RE: withdrawal symptoms after anastrazole by JoyceJJL on Tue Aug 04, 2015 02:03 PM Quote | Reply Just did some research and actually what you're on is the one I couldnt take.  Its other name is Arimidex.   I would definitely see your Dr again or just go to another oncologist for another opinion.    Unless you feel comfortable with him or her.  They did have me on it for 2 weeks, But had bad side effects so thats when He put me on Femara.  I personnaly think all of the hormone drugs raise cane with our systems   I almost stopped it all together.  But with stage 3b I didnt dare too.  Good luck with either choice.  Hope & pray you feel better soon.
Posts.Title: withdrawal symptoms after anastrazole

Posts.Content: You certainly have been given a plateful :(  I had breast cancer 2 times.  Recently had a double mastectomy and chemo and radiation.  If theres anything you'd like to talk about Please feel free to message me.  It really is a terrible disease, and unless you've had it no one knows what its like.  Please know my thoughts arw with you.,  Joyce
Posts.Title: 4th time getting cancer in the lymph nodes

Posts.Content: I had problems with it after my operation.  But not since, however I know someone who has, and they go to physical therapy to keep their arms moving so the fluid doesnt build up.  I know I cant afford physical therapy   But you could go for one visit and have them tell you what to do.  There are certain exercises that they have to keep this fluid from building up. Hope this helped. Good Luck   Joyce
Posts.Title: Lymph Drainage

Posts.Content: Hi I never knew that so many many people were going through the same pains as I am until I came here.  I have been on Fermara for 2 years, and I feel like I am 90 years old, although I klnow someone 90 and they get around better than myself and I am 63.  I tried arimidex and aromasin and had side effects.  Question????  IF I stop taking the drug, does that autoimatically mean the cancer will come back?  I had stage 3b  invasive ductal cancer.  Had a double mastectomy , chemo and radiation.  I almost consider stopping the drug and seeing what happens as far as being able to walk normal without pain.  I sit for more than 10 minutes and I need a cane to get up.  Yes someone else mentioned getting up in the morning is terrible, which it is.   I am not glad that you all have pain, but I thought alot of this was in my head.:(   Thanks any replies to me are really appreciated, and as for the question I would like to know if anyone has stopped or knows of anyone that has   Thanks Joyce
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: I take fermara and its has terrible side effects, I did try Aromasin and had side effects also.  I am on fermara now.  But there is rimadex out there also, buy my oncologist said most all of them have basically the same side effects.  I wish they had one that we all didnt get side effects from.  My bones & joints ache like hell :(
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: HI I have been taking Femara for 2 yrs and my joints and legs, back are killing me,.   I tried the aromasin and arimidex, but had different side effects.  I am seriously considering to be asked to be taken off of this.  I have read so many posts about the side effects of this drug or others its beginning to scare me.  I can barely walk without leg pain.  I just wish I knew more about what would happen if I stopped this.  But its beginning to be more of an option to stop.  As its a continual joint pain 24/7.   Is everyone else having these symptoms?  I wonder if there are people that dont have this problem.,  Mine was a stage 3b ductal breast cancer and had a double mastectomy , chemo & radiation.  Would love to hear feed back from others.  Thanks   Joyce
Posts.Title: Side Effects From Aromasin

Posts.Content: Gail  It could be the medication.  I would definitely check with her oncologist,.  I tried 2 different ones and Arimedex was one I couldnt deal with, but I am on Fermara and that has side effects too.  Mostly bone & joint pain, its very hard to tolerate.  But I have found by listening to others most of them are.  I have had panic attacks all my life, but I take klonopin for them.  So maybe she needs a anxiety pill to help her, or it just might be a side effect of the Arimedex, but would definitely check with the Dr.
Posts.Title: ARIMEDEX

Posts.Content: I started taking  Glucosamine?Chrondroitin   4 days ago, with the ok from my Dr.  I could not stand the bone & joint pain any longer.  I read someones post on here a few weeks ago about taking it.  They take 500mg 3 times a day. However the only one I could find was 1500, so I asked my Dr and she said take 1 pill a day.  Now whether its someone up above helping me or the pills I dont know,.  But I am beginning to feel less pain.  I admit there is still alot of bone & joint pain still there,.  But not like it was and its only been 4 days taking this.  However I do make sure I take it with a  meal. As she mentioned to take food with it.  I have Gerd, maybe thats why.  But ask your Dr many amny people have mentioned this outside since I said I was taking it, and they agreed it would help joint pain.  I pray this helps someone.  Thank you to the person who got me on it. Joyce
Posts.Title: Glucosamine/Chrondroitin

Posts.Content: OOPS  My Name is Joyce  I am 62 yrs old now and live in Massachusetts  I had stage3b ductal breast cancer and am now currently taking a 5 yr horomone cancer pill.  But it does have its side affects Joyce
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Awareness: Help Needed

Posts.Content: Sounds like the same symptoms as Fermara.  they're not pleasant.   Do you take vitamin D?  They mentioned taking calcium with vitamin D in them to me
Posts.Title: Ariimedex

Posts.Content: Hi I had breast cancer 20 yrs ago, and then it reoccured 2008 and had a double mastectomy, with chemo & radiation.  I will try and look up pictures I have.  I know when I went completely bald, my Mom (now passed) my Sister and alot of my nephews had their head shaved.  It was such a beautiful gesture.  This disease is by no means anything to take lightly, BUT we have to "try" and keep a positive attitude.  Unless you have gone thru it, you really dont know.  And Thank God for those that havent had it.  I found alot of strength thru Family & Friends,  But a very large of it came from others suffereing from the same disease.  That I would meet whenever I had chemo  then radiation. There used to be a toll free cancer line that macthed your type of cancer to someone else.  Which they did, but I think its no longer available on a 1 to 1 basis.  But I will check with the person I had and see if they've brought it back.  Please know my thought and prayers are with you all.  And I will  check to see what I ave to contribute.   Joyce
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer Awareness: Help Needed

Posts.Content: My oncologist is starting me on Aromasin now that I have completed my chemo He also wants me to have radiation, I had a double mastectomy, and am not sure what he would be radiating???  Does anyone else have this dilema?.  Is it a steroid?  He has been saying Arimedex all along, but suddenly said No we'll go with aromasin.  I am so glad to hear your pain free now.  I am so scared of going on any of the drugs, after reading the message board.  I have terrible lower back pain now, and it seems like whenever I read any posts it gets worse with the 5 yr treatment.  Thank JOyce
Posts.Title: End of side effects from Aromasin

Posts.Content: I sure hope the Aromasin isnt as bad as the Arimidex.   I tried both and had same side effects, so they put me on fermara, which I think is just as bad if not worse.  Gosh I can't imagine being without body pain.  I did just come from the pharamist, and discussed what ma ny others have been saying to take.  Glucosamine/Chrondroitin.  I did buy it,  they actually had a sale  buy one get one free.  I asked the pharmasist and she said they had done studies on it and it did prove to relieve some bone & jloint pain.  But if you are allergic to shellfish you can;t take it.  But the younger girl that was there, take the Glucosimine for her bones, as shes studying to be a Pharmacists.   I was soooo Happy I could get it and they agreed it is supposed to help.  The studies werent cancer related but bone & joint related,.  Ask your oncologist about it.  I see my Radiologist and Primary this week to be sure its ok.  But any help from this pain would be a relief.  5 Years is a long time for any of us to be taking something to help prevent cancer and be in pain.  Good Luck and I hope the new drug isnt as bad. Joyce
Posts.Title: Ariimedex

Posts.Content: I have been on Femara for 2 yrs.  And havent gotten that sensation.  I had breast cancer, what type did you have? If this continues I would definitely call your Dr I havent heard of anyone else having those symptoms,  But everyone is different.   I get terrible bone & joint pain.  But as I said everyone is different,  Take care Joyce
Posts.Title: femara and chest pain

Posts.Content: I had chemo in 2008  stage 3b breast cancer with radiation and now am taking fermara, But for the last 4 months I have had terrible cramping.  Seems like it wouldnt be doing it now tho. But last night it was in my upper leg and there was nothing I could do to stop it, and it killed me.  Yes I have had cramps in legs, and thighs and hands earlier on tho.  I cant eat bananas tho:(  Are you on hormone pills?
Posts.Title: cramping a year after chemo / breast cancer

Posts.Content: I sure hope the Aromasin isnt as bad as the Arimidex.   I tried both and had same side effects, so they put me on fermara, which I think is just as bad if not worse.  Gosh I can't imagine being without body pain.  I did just come from the pharamist, and discussed what ma ny others have been saying to take.  Glucosamine/Chrondroitin.  I did buy it,  they actually had a sale  buy one get one free.  I asked the pharmasist and she said they had done studies on it and it did prove to relieve some bone & jloint pain.  But if you are allergic to shellfish you can;t take it.  But the younger girl that was there, take the Glucosimine for her bones, as shes studying to be a Pharmacists.   I was soooo Happy I could get it and they agreed it is supposed to help.  The studies werent cancer related but bone & joint related,.  Ask your oncologist about it.  I see my Radiologist and Primary this week to be sure its ok.  But any help from this pain would be a relief.  5 Years is a long time for any of us to be taking something to help prevent cancer and be in pain.  Good Luck and I hope the new drug isnt as bad. Joyce
Posts.Title: Ariimedex

Posts.Content: Yes I had stage 3b breast cancer 2 yrs ago. and I had what they called the "TAC"  chemo, which one of them was Taxotere.  I had it thru the chemo every third week along with Cytoxin, and Adromycin (sp)     I dont know about the other 2 drugs you mentioned.  But those combination of drugs have kept me here for 2 more yrs.  I know its the "Unknown"  which scares us all.  I hope this helps.'  Joyce
Posts.Title: Anyone heard of the drug Taxotere?

Posts.Content: I had tried arimidex, and aromasin  my oncologist put me on fermara and I got the same side effects from all of them.  Terrible aching bones and joints. I really think they all basically have the same side effects.  Some people dont feel them as bad as others.  My oncologist said unfortunately there are side effects.  I have noticed headaches also.  My primary did tell me to take calcium and vitamin D also.  I just started last week, hopefully they will help.  Thank you for that infor mation that it has helped you
Posts.Title: Ariimedex

Posts.Content: I had a double mastecomy 2 years ago, they gave me the "TAC" chemo  Which one was Taxotere. I had that through my port for 4 months. I did get nausea, but they gave me meds, which did help, but I think anyone getting any type of chemo it drains you unless you get lucky.  But Please be sure to drink plenty of fluids.  I didnt like water, so I made crystal light and drank other kinds of things that contained water. I had stage 3bherpostive, invasive bs.  I wished you hadnt had it return:(  But I wish you the best in winning the battle again.  Stay strong my Friend. Joyce
Posts.Title: Taxotere

Posts.Content: Hi  I havent had any hair loss other than when I had chemo.  I have been on fermara for 2 1/2 years.   I admit my bones & joints are horrific with pain , BUT someone posted a while back to take  Glucosamine/Chrondroitin and it helped them and then I read a few other posts that it helped greatly.  They were taking 500mgs 3 times a day.  But I started out with 1500, and only took it once a day.  I have been on it for 4 days, and already I can feel a relief in joint pain.  I did ask my Dr before I took it.  And she said it was fine.  I was at the point where I considered stopping it as like many I didnt know if I could put up with the side effects verses the quality of life.  I hope this has helped some of you. Joyce
Posts.Title: Femara & Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Thank you both so much for the info.  I have a Drs appt this week,  Well 2 lol  one radiologist and one Primary, but need to go to the drug store today so will ask the pharmacist if I  can get a bottle.  I'm willing to try most anything to stop this joint & bone pain.  Thanks again Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: Hi What was FEC?  I know the T was Taxotere, but for the life of me I can;t remember the other 2 names. I know they just said it was "TAC"   I also rmember 2 DAYS after I had to go get a shot in the arm at the Hospital to build up my system.  Possibly that was a steroid shot. When they say 'chemobrain'  I never believed them, but my me mory has gotten terrible. But again I'm here tro talk about it.  I hope you dont get nausea from it. Joyce
Posts.Title: Taxotere

Posts.Content: Thank I never knew we could get chemo brain until I mentioned casually to my surgeon I was upset for forgetting things and not being as quick as I used to be.  And she agreed along with my oncologist, there is such a thing as chemo brain.  But I try and fluff it off too.  Sometimes it doesnt work tho.  I get discusted with myself for forgetting such small things.  Take care  Joyce
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain

Posts.Content: Thank you I will
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: HI I just came back from the drug store, and got  Glucosamine/Chrondrotin.  It says double strength, they only had double or triple strength.  Says take 3 a day. Glucosimine 1500mg  Chrondroitin sulfate 1200mg  The druggist said they were good for joint pain.  Is this the same as you take?  I guess if you're allerfic to shellfish you cant take it. Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: Do I need a script for these two?  Or can I just go to the drug store and get them?   Are there generic names for them?  Full of questions  LOL But if they work I will try them.  Thanks very much
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: Thank I never knew we could get chemo brain until I mentioned casually to my surgeon I was upset for forgetting things and not being as quick as I used to be.  And she agreed along with my oncologist, there is such a thing as chemo brain.  But I try and fluff it off too.  Sometimes it doesnt work tho.  I get discusted with myself for forgetting such small things.  Take care  Joyce
Posts.Title: Chemo Brain

Posts.Content: Hi  I havent had any hair loss other than when I had chemo.  I have been on fermara for 2 1/2 years.   I admit my bones & joints are horrific with pain , BUT someone posted a while back to take  Glucosamine/Chrondroitin and it helped them and then I read a few other posts that it helped greatly.  They were taking 500mgs 3 times a day.  But I started out with 1500, and only took it once a day.  I have been on it for 4 days, and already I can feel a relief in joint pain.  I did ask my Dr before I took it.  And she said it was fine.  I was at the point where I considered stopping it as like many I didnt know if I could put up with the side effects verses the quality of life.  I hope this has helped some of you. Joyce
Posts.Title: Femara & Hair Loss

Posts.Content: Dave I know you are trying to help alot of us, by mentioning that the hemo etc  etc kills the good cells, and reduces our immune system a great deal.  However, unless you have been through this and are at a point that its either try the chemo and go into remission and or get it out of your sytem for a time, one never knows what they would do until faced with that decision. I always swore I would never have my breasts removed or do chemo,.  But if I didnt I wouldnt be here typing.  I know on your name you fully believe in Hollistic, and I am sure people could probably purchase it from you.  Which is all well and good IF they want to go that route and many do,. However I am one that did what I said I never would, and would do it again.  I guess its the old "cliche" to each their own.  I am just saying I did try the chem and they do tell you what its doing to you and its up to me or anyone else who chooses that route whether or not to do the chemo through your system,  I am only saying my perspective as well as you did yours.  I respect yours, so Please respect those of us who choose the opposite.  Thanks Joyce
Posts.Title: Taxotere

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for answering my post.  I will go there ASAP  in the am.  I hope they work as well for me.  I reallty appreciate it.  Hope you're doing well. Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: Thank you both so much for the info.  I have a Drs appt this week,  Well 2 lol  one radiologist and one Primary, but need to go to the drug store today so will ask the pharmacist if I  can get a bottle.  I'm willing to try most anything to stop this joint & bone pain.  Thanks again Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for answering my post.  I will go there ASAP  in the am.  I hope they work as well for me.  I reallty appreciate it.  Hope you're doing well. Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: I sure hope you get back to us.  I dfo wish you best wishes for a good recovery.  Hugs Joyce  <3
Posts.Title: abnormal MRI, MAMMOGRAM insisting I'm fine

Posts.Content: HI I just came back from the drug store, and got  Glucosamine/Chrondrotin.  It says double strength, they only had double or triple strength.  Says take 3 a day. Glucosimine 1500mg  Chrondroitin sulfate 1200mg  The druggist said they were good for joint pain.  Is this the same as you take?  I guess if you're allerfic to shellfish you cant take it. Joyce
Posts.Title: side effects from femara

Posts.Content: What an excellent response .  I have been on Fermara for 4 years, and Yes it puts weight on and kills the bones.  I also take percoset for the pain.    I had stage 3b invasive ductal cancer.  Had a double mastectomy,  went the whole gammit, the first hormone they put me on armidex, I had terrible side effects to, so he changed,.  I truly believe most all of what you have said.  Maybe some Drs should  "walk a mile in my shoes"  It hurts like heck.  Thanks again for the tips you posted.  Take care my Friend'  Joyce
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4

Posts.Content: No unfortunately I dont have a pool.  But I have heard of others that have one and it helps.   I sure am glad it helps you in some way.  In fact a long time ago there was someone that had a jacquizi (sp) installed and it helped immensly .   Thank you for getting back to me.  Hopefully we can keep in touch.  Keep swimming if that helps.    Joyce
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4

Posts.Content: Hi when I got the neulasta shots 2 yrs ago, they made me feel the same way.  And now I am on femara which feels about the same.  How much longer do you have to go thru therapy? Joyce
Posts.Title: Neulasta

Posts.Content: I would definitely get it checked out.  It may be nothing at all but scar tissue.  Or you can develop adhesions years after.  But Please ask your Dr. Good Luck
Posts.Title: breast area pain near scar
